CatDescriptText: Armenia Johnson, secretary to a blind case worker, 7312 Race Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe Negroes, who get public assistance, do more cheating than whites?" answer reads: "I can't say. I've only been working one month at public assistance and have not come across anyone who has cheated."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Armenia Johnson wearing earrings, dark blouse with light colored stripes, and coat with dark floral embroidery on upper portion of lapels and cuffs of pockets, holding dark handbag under left arm, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with sign that reads "Sit... ey Co. ...ts Kn... Hats", Liberty Avenue, Downtown
